ref: 10191 muṇḍa1 ʻ shaved, bald, lopped ʼ MBh., ʻ hornless ʼ VarBr̥S., ʻ blunt ʼ Kathās., m. = ˚aka -- m. ʻ trunk of lopped tree ʼ lex. [Prob. of Drav. origin (A. Master BSOAS xii 354) with coalescence of two Drav. wordgroups (DED 4199, 4200); less likely Mu. connexions (J. Przyluski BSL xxx 199, PMWS 102). Not with P. Thieme ZDMG 93, 134 < *mr̥ṁṣṭa -- nor with P. Tedesco JAOS 65, 82 < vr̥ddha -- 2 ʻ cut ʼ. In IA. it forms part of ʻ defective ʼ word -- group s.v. *muṭṭa -- 1 with all variations characteristic of such groups. -- Cf. *muṇḍa -- 2 ʻ lump ʼ]
Pa. muṇḍa -- , ˚aka -- ʻ bald, shaven ʼ, muṇḍaka -- kaṇṇa<-> ʻ having blunt corners ʼ;
Pk. muṁḍa -- ʻ shaved ʼ, ˚ḍā -- f. ʻ doe ʼ;
Phal. múṇḍo ʻ blunt ʼ;
K. mŏnḍ f. ʻ widow ʼ, mọ̆nḍu ʻ blunt, dull, stupid ʼ, m. ʻ stump of a tree ʼ, &obrevdotdot f. ʻ thick underground stalk ʼ, mŏnḍuru m. ʻ widower, stump of a tree ʼ;
S. muno ʻ blunt, less by a quarter ʼ, m. ʻ upright post of water -- or spinning -- wheel ʼ, munī f. ʻ post, stake ʼ;
L. munn m. ʻ pillar, post ʼ, munnī f. ʻ post in middle of threshing floor, upright gravestone ʼ, munnã̄ ʻ less by a quarter ʼ,
awāṇ. sir -- munnī f. ʻ girl with shaved head ʼ;
P. munnī f. ʻ girl ʼ, muṇḍā m. ʻ boy ʼ, munnā m. ʻ penis, plough -- handle ʼ;
Ku. mũṛo ʻ stump ʼ;
Or. muṇḍa ʻ pollard, trunk ʼ, muṇḍā ʻ blunt, wifeless, childless ʼ, sb. ʻ stump ʼ;
Or. muṇḍa ʻ pollard, trunk ʼ, muṇḍā ʻ blunt, wifeless, childless ʼ, sb. ʻ stump ʼ;
Or. muṇḍa ʻ pollard, trunk ʼ, muṇḍā ʻ blunt, wifeless, childless ʼ, sb. ʻ stump ʼ;
Or. muṇḍa ʻ pollard, trunk ʼ, muṇḍā ʻ blunt, wifeless, childless ʼ, sb. ʻ stump ʼ;
Bi. mū̃ṛ, ˚ṛā, ˚ṛī ʻ ball at end of beam of sugar -- mill ʼ, muṇḍā, mũṛlā, mũṛeṛā (< *mũṛerā?) ʻ hornless ox ʼ, mũṛiyā, mũṛilwā ʻ beardless wheat ʼ;
Mth. mū̃ṛ ʻ trunk of cut tree ʼ, mū̃ṛā ʻ hornless ox ʼ, muṇḍā ʻ round cap covering the ears (worn by Brahmans) ʼ;
H. muṇḍā ʻ shaved ʼ;
G. mū̃ḍɔ m. ʻ shaven head ʼ;
M. mũḍā ʻ bald, shaven ʼ,
Si. muḍa. --
Kho. mun ʻ stump of tree ʼ, (Lor.) kər -- mvn ʻ crop -- eared ʼ and
Sh. (Lor.) mūn, pl. ˚ní ʻ stump or bole of tree, stump of amputated leg or arm, maize stubble ʼ are either ←
